Score.GAD7: The GAD-7 is scored by assigning scores of 0, 1, 2, and 3, to the response categories of not at all,several days,more than half the days, and nearly every day, respectively. GAD-7 total score for the seven items ranges from 0 to 21. Scores of 5, 10, and 15 represent cutpoints for mild, moderate, and severe anxiety, respectively.
Score.PTSD_CHILDREN_AND_YOUTH: if your score>5, this suggest problems with Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD).
Score.PTSD_Adults: If your score>=2:Current research suggests that the results of the PC-PTSD should be considered positive if a person answers yes to any two items or the single hyper-arousal item.

Score.Goldberg_Bipolar_Screening_Quiz: This questionnaire is valid only if you are 18 or older and have had a depression severe enough to have caused distress and/or interfered with your functioning in one or more important areas of life such as home, work, school, or interpersonal relationships. Scores are added up over the 12 questions. Individuals with total scores of 15 or less are most likely suffering from Major (unipolar) Depression. Those scoring between 16 and 24 may have either major depression or a disorder in the bipolar spectrum. Those scoring 25 or more have a high probability of having a bipolar spectrum disorder.
